TopicTitle: Deployed surface experiments spamming tiny science

Articles.Content: My deployed surface experiment on Minmus is sending back .007 science at a time every few minutes.  I go to check on another craft and come back to 200+ messages in queue after a few in-game hours.  Anyone else run into this?
Is this forum area actually for support or is it where support requests go to die? This is a game breaking issue--not one peep from any dev or help from anyone about it.
Hardly game-breaking, but definitely annoying. And yeah, the silence on this has been deafening

Ugh, well, at least I'm not the only one seeing this.

This is annoying as all heck.

Someone misplaced a decimal somewhere, should be an easy fix once we figure out where.

Is this in the bugtracker?

And it is in the bugtracker.

https://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/23269

Please upvote so it gets attention.  Currently it's listed as 'Low'.

I've got over 1000 message notifications from the sceince experiment spam and there's no way to clear them easily. It's pretty stupid.

Edited August 22, 2019 by THX1138
There is a value in the savefiles that you can edit to fix this ("ScienceTimeDelay"), or install that:

This was fixed in 1.8 update.
